Entries.default:
"How might I help you out of a bit of money, squab? Care to join our fun? Or is it swill and information you're chasing?"

The pirate looks you over, eying the make of you. A sly smile curls at his mouth as he tosses a pair of dice to rattle over the cobblestone ground.
He rolls a spare die over the tops of his fingers, making it appear and disappear with fluid flicks of his hand.
"You're bad luck, chum. Do us a favor and sod off."
"Hang it all. That nearly damned flattened me."
"Now that's what I call a lucky break."
"Damn me and Ondra's worthless son!"
[Roll the dice around in your hand.] "Your dice are weighted."
"You win most of these games you run, do you?"
"I'll play a round."
"Farewell."
"How did you get those?! Wait, I mean... those aren't mine. No, no. I've never seen those dice before in my life."

"Those are your dice, Snake Eyes. I can tell because of they got the same chip in one corner. See?"

The pirate narrows her eyes as she points toward the set of die, understanding suddenly dawning. Grumbling, the others close in.

"Now, now. mates, let's not do anything hasty... that I might regret...!"

Backing up a few steps, he stumbles, before turning to bolt.
"You wouldn't be implying there's more to it than my superb luck and skills?"
"You're wanting to stir up trouble, but I know you got nothing on me. Sod off 'afore I remove you."
"And risk my winning streak against these fine ruffians?"
"I can't help it if I win back to back, six times in a row. Luck of the roll is all it is."
"What the -?!"
"Some unlucky sot will hang for this one."
"I'm looking for Captain Benweth."
"I ain't my captain's keeper. And I know better than to ask what business you've got with Brutal Ben." He jerks his head once to the right.
Without so much as a glance at the settling dice, he calls out their numbers.
"You might check the Court for him. If he ain't target practicing, he's tickling the harpsichord, or taking his swill. Two out of three can be done there."
"But if you see him, don't fucking tell him I sent you."
"You're far too much of a lucky sort of princock for me. I'll pass."
"'Cause accusations such as that are likely to see you whipped and pickled, my mate."
"I hear Unlucky Ancret owes you quite a debt."
"That she does. She's my biggest loser - hence the name."
"It's a shame really, how she always fumbles the dice. It's cause she's got those burly hands. Surely."
"A hundred pires per roll of the dice. You sure you want to risk it?"
"I'll bet on high."
"Never mind."
He shrugs one shoulder.
"Looks like you've won..." He scowls sourly as he looks you up and down, eyes narrowed.
"You lose, mate. What a shame!" He chuckles as he grabs for the dice.
With a grunt, he tosses you double the copper staked.

This time when Snake Eyes grabs up the dice from the cobblestones, he leans forward, blocking them from view for a sliver of a second. 

The dice he holds after are almost identical to the ones from before - aside from a tiny chip on the corner of each.
"Takes odds to win, but she couldn't roll a seven even if our brutal captain put a pistol to her brow."
"I'll bet on low."
The dice add up to two.
The dice add up to three.
The dice add up to four.
The dice add up to five.
The dice add up to six.
The dice add up to seven.
The dice add up to eight.
The dice add up to nine.
The dice add up to ten.
The dice add up to eleven.
The dice add up to twelve.
Snake Eyes jiggles the dice in his hand. After blowing onto them for luck, he casts the dice across the ground.
"Care for another roll?"
"I thank you for playing, but we're done here, mate. Only so much coin I can stand lose to the same lucky sot."
"Looks like you've won..." He scowls sourly as he looks you up and down, eyes narrowed.
"You lose, mate. What a shame!" He chuckles as he grabs for the dice.
The dice add up to two.
The dice add up to three.
The dice add up to four.
The dice add up to ten.
The dice add up to eleven.
The dice add up to twelve.
"I'll bet on seven."
"Looks like you've won..." He scowls sourly as he looks you up and down, eyes narrowed.
"You lose, mate. What a shame!" He chuckles as he grabs for the dice.
"Careful, pal. You're a little too lucky for your own good, I think." With a heavy sigh, he hands you quadruple the stake.
"Now before we get rolling, let me tell you the rules."
"Lastly, you can also bet on seven. "If the count is exactly seven then you win four times the wager."

Grumbling, Snake Eyes snatches the dice from the ground. As he leans forward, he slips his free hand under the folds of his shirt. 

He tenses, confusion flooding his face before his eyes widen with panic.
[Say nothing.]
[Roll the rigged dice around in your hand.] "Looking for these?"
"You bet on high if you think when the dice settle, they'll count up to more than seven. "You bet on low if you think the count will be less than seven. "Both pay double or nothing."
"Came to watch another round?"
"Yeah. I like to watch."
He chokes, dropping the dice prematurely. They skitter across the cobblestones. Then a cheer erupts from the gamblers as the dice settle on a sweeping win.
"Show's over. Buy in or shove off." Scowling, he snatches up the dice before reluctantly paying the winners.
With a chuckle, he pats the left pocket of his pants - a nervous gesture.
